header: Cri.Bail Application no. 195/19 CNR No. MHPU01-000726-2019

background.text: ORDER BELOW EXH.1 1] Perused application and say. Heard Advocate for applicant and APP for the State. 2] This is first bail application filed under section 439 of Cr.P.C. by applicant in respect of his arrest in C.R. no. 711/18 registered at Saswad Police Station for the offence punishable under section 354,354A,354D,506 of the Indian Penal Code and under section 12 of the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act, 2012.

legalActFound.stringMatched: under section 439 of cr.p.c. by applicant in respect of his arrest in c.r. no. 711/18 registered at saswad police station for the offence punishable under section 354,354a,354d,506 of the indian penal code

arguments.text: It is alleged that victim aged about 14 years lodged report stating that she was acquainted with applicant as he is grandson of her neighbourer and used to come to Yadavwadi occassionally. In Summer Vacation applicant came to house of her grandmother and he was talking with victim but he was staring at her with bad intention, he thereafter was following victim and tried to contact her when she was attending her school. She then narrated the incident to her parents and avoided to talk with applicant. Later on applicant was contacting her from two mobile sim cards and he proposed her, followed her. Prior to 15 days he threatened her to defame in village if she did not respond to him. In Christmas vacation on 26.12.2018 applicant threatened to throw acid on her person and to kill her if she would not come to meet her.

argumentSentences.text: It is alleged that victim aged about 14 years lodged report stating that she was acquainted with applicant as he is grandson of her neighbourer and used to come to Yadavwadi occassionally.

In Summer Vacation applicant came to house of her grandmother and he was talking with victim but he was staring at her with bad intention, he thereafter was following victim and tried to contact her when she was attending her school.
She then narrated the incident to her parents and avoided to talk with applicant.
Later on applicant was contacting her from two mobile sim cards and he proposed her, followed her.
Prior to 15 days he threatened her to defame in village if she did not respond to him.
In Christmas vacation on 26.12.2018 applicant threatened to throw acid on her person and to kill her if she would not come to meet her.

arguments.text: 3] According to applicant he is falsely implicated in this matter. He is college going and student. He has no criminal antecedents. He is permanently residing at Guruwar Peth, Gauri Ali, Pune. Investigation is practically over. He is ready to abide the conditions. Hence, he prayed to release him on bail.

argumentSentences.text: 3] According to applicant he is falsely implicated in this matter.
He is college going and student.
He has no criminal antecedents.
He is permanently residing at Guruwar Peth, Gauri Ali, Pune.
Investigation is practically over.
He is ready to abide the conditions.
Hence, he prayed to release him on bail.

arguments.text: 4] APP and I.O. objected this application on the ground that investigation is in progress. Applicant will pressurize victim and witnesses. There is possibility of tampering prosecution evidence. So, they prayed to reject the application.

argumentSentences.text: 4] APP and I.O. objected this application on the ground that investigation is in progress.
Applicant will pressurize victim and witnesses.
There is possibility of tampering prosecution evidence.
So, they prayed to reject the application.

arguments.text: 5] Allegations against the applicant are serious. Applicant is sufficiently interrogated. Considering allegations and nature of offence investigation is practically over. Personal custody of applicant is not required. Applicant is student and resident of Guruwar Peth, Gauri Ali, Pune. Applicant has no criminal antecedents. No purpose would serve by keeping the applicant behind bar for unknown period. Due to all above reasons application deserves to be allowed with following order ­

argumentSentences.text: 5] Allegations against the applicant are serious.
Applicant is sufficiently interrogated.
Considering allegations and nature of offence investigation is practically over.
Personal custody of applicant is not required.
Applicant is student and resident of Guruwar Peth, Gauri Ali, Pune.
Applicant has no criminal antecedents.
No purpose would serve by keeping the applicant behind bar for unknown period.
Due to all above reasons application deserves to be allowed with following order ­

order.text: ORDER 1] The application is allowed. 2] The applicant Vikrant Uddhav Yadav be released on executing P.R. bond of Rs.30,000/­ with one or two solvent sureties in the like amount. 3] The applicant shall not tamper the prosecution witnesses in any manner. 4] The applicant shall attend Saswad Police Station on every Monday between 11.00 a.m. to 2.00 p.m. till the charge­sheet is filed. 5] The applicant shall not meet, harass, threat and pressurize the victim and shall not enter into vicinity of residence of victim and shall not repeat the offence. 6] The applicant shall co­operate investigating machinery as and when required. 7] Prior to furnishing surety, the applicant shall submit his address proof, mobile number and inform about the change in address and mobile number.

footer: Pune. (R.V.Adone) Date – 14.01.2019. Addl.Sessions Judge, Pune. “ I affirm that the contents of the P.D.F. File Judgment are same word for word as per original judgment. Name of Steno ­ S.V.Thakar, Court Name ­ Smt. R.V.Adone, Addl.Sessions Judge,Pune. Date of Order ­ 14.01.2019 Order signed by P.O. ­ 14.01.2019 Order uploaded on ­ 17.01.2019
processedText:
Cri.Bail Application no. 195/19 CNR No. MHPU01-000726-2019 
---header-ends---
ORDER BELOW EXH.1 1] Perused application and say. Heard Advocate for applicant and APP for the State. 2] This is first bail application filed under section 439 of Cr.P.C. by applicant in respect of his arrest in C.R. no. 711/18 registered at Saswad Police Station for the offence punishable under section 354,354A,354D,506 of the Indian Penal Code and under section 12 of the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act, 2012. 
---background-ends---
It is alleged that victim aged about 14 years lodged report stating that she was acquainted with applicant as he is grandson of her neighbourer and used to come to Yadavwadi occassionally. In Summer Vacation applicant came to house of her grandmother and he was talking with victim but he was staring at her with bad intention, he thereafter was following victim and tried to contact her when she was attending her school. She then narrated the incident to her parents and avoided to talk with applicant. Later on applicant was contacting her from two mobile sim cards and he proposed her, followed her. Prior to 15 days he threatened her to defame in village if she did not respond to him. In Christmas vacation on 26.12.2018 applicant threatened to throw acid on her person and to kill her if she would not come to meet her. 
---argument-ends---
3] According to applicant he is falsely implicated in this matter. He is college going and student. He has no criminal antecedents. He is permanently residing at Guruwar Peth, Gauri Ali, Pune. Investigation is practically over. He is ready to abide the conditions. Hence, he prayed to release him on bail. 
---argument-ends---
4] APP and I.O. objected this application on the ground that investigation is in progress. Applicant will pressurize victim and witnesses. There is possibility of tampering prosecution evidence. So, they prayed to reject the application. 
---argument-ends---
5] Allegations against the applicant are serious. Applicant is sufficiently interrogated. Considering allegations and nature of offence investigation is practically over. Personal custody of applicant is not required. Applicant is student and resident of Guruwar Peth, Gauri Ali, Pune. Applicant has no criminal antecedents. No purpose would serve by keeping the applicant behind bar for unknown period. Due to all above reasons application deserves to be allowed with following order ­ 
---argument-ends---
ORDER 1] The application is allowed. 2] The applicant Vikrant Uddhav Yadav be released on executing P.R. bond of Rs.30,000/­ with one or two solvent sureties in the like amount. 3] The applicant shall not tamper the prosecution witnesses in any manner. 4] The applicant shall attend Saswad Police Station on every Monday between 11.00 a.m. to 2.00 p.m. till the charge­sheet is filed. 5] The applicant shall not meet, harass, threat and pressurize the victim and shall not enter into vicinity of residence of victim and shall not repeat the offence. 6] The applicant shall co­operate investigating machinery as and when required. 7] Prior to furnishing surety, the applicant shall submit his address proof, mobile number and inform about the change in address and mobile number. 
---order-ends---
Pune. (R.V.Adone) Date – 14.01.2019. Addl.Sessions Judge, Pune. “ I affirm that the contents of the P.D.F. File Judgment are same word for word as per original judgment. Name of Steno ­ S.V.Thakar, Court Name ­ Smt. R.V.Adone, Addl.Sessions Judge,Pune. Date of Order ­ 14.01.2019 Order signed by P.O. ­ 14.01.2019 Order uploaded on ­ 17.01.2019
